page.title: 01REVIEW Pentney & Narboro'
page.content:
{Pentney and Narborough}are two villages situated in the Nar valley which is a predominately rural farming area in north west Norfolk.
The nearest large town is{King's Lynn} 8 miles to the west and the smaller market town of{Swaffham}is 7 miles to the south east. A large operational R.A.F. station is situated a mile to the south at{Marham.
It is a pleasant area attracting many visitors who come to stay at the caravan park or to partake of such amenities as trout fishing, water ski-ing and bowls.
Many buildings are of historic interest and the two villages are worth stopping off to look at when passing through.
